titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The morning post brought a long & interesting letter from
, in which he expressed himself very flatterously respecting my All Souls sermon, of which he had obtained the MS. from
. He wrote about the War, & said some acute things about
, whom he evidently distrusts. A consignment of the Huguenot sermons arrived from the publishers. I sent away 15 copies, & ordered 50 to be sent to
I spent most part of the day in writing
an article for the "Church Family Newspaper
conception of the Church of England. Also I attended Evensong. After dinner I read the Guildhall speeches aloud to my wife. A letter from
, designed for my Birthday, reached me today.
sent me his Harvard Review article on "The Position & Prospects of the Roman Catholic Church" – an extremely interesting and well–informed discussion of a complicated subject.
